abstract: Evgeny Buryakov, Russian bank employee in New York, pleads guilty to conspiracy, admitting plans to act on behalf of Russia's SVR intelligence agency; faces up to five years in prison; two other Russians, Igor Sporyshev and Victor Podobnyy, who were also charged, have left country.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors accused Evgeny Buryakov and two other men in New York as being part of a ring that collected intelligence on behalf of the S.V.R., the Russian foreign intelligence agency.

headline.main: Bank Employee Pleads Guilty to Conspiring to Work as Secret Russian Agent
headline.print_headline: Bank Employee Pleads Guilty to Conspiring to Work as Secret Russian Agent

snippet: Prosecutors accused Evgeny Buryakov and two other men in New York as being part of a ring that collected intelligence on behalf of the S.V.R., the Russian foreign intelligence agency.
